subject: Re: Mike's Box 12.470 Proto 1
author: M.A. Coletta (Mike)
full_text:
Hi LC,

Yes, the 12-469 has that "clicking" sound while sweeping the AM band. 
All my 12-469's do it.  Maybe someone can come up with a way to quiet 
it?

I use the older version 12-470 in my sound chamber method. The older 
12-470 has a quieter sweep mode, no "clicking".  Plus it has the 
built-in speaker which I really like!

The 12-470 doesn't pick up the "My Lil Reminder" internally as far as 
I can tell. It just mixes the sounds in the sound chamber.  The 12-
469 and 12-470 use different circuit boards.  Maybe the 12-470 has 
better filtering???

(Note: The newer version of the 12-470 (black, non-hack one) has an 
entirely different circuit board too).

The clam pack was the packaging for an item I bought for my old cell 
phone.  I saw it and used it for the proto 1.  I'm now looking for a 
more durable clear box so I can build a few more of these systems 
using 12-470's.

- Mike

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@...> wrote:
>
> Mike, two more questions for you.  When I sweep the AM dial, I get 
a 
> loud "click" on each frequency as it scans.  Also, when the "My Lil 
> Reminder" playing white noise gets near the AM radio sweep, it gets 
> picked up by the unit and broadcasts it.  Are you experiencing the 
> same thing?  Also, where are you getting the clam packs?
> 
> LC
>

> > > by all.  The proect boxes come in various sizes and are cheap

> > > > > > > > Hi LC,
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > The two setups I did were:
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > 1) Three 12-469's through a mixer, mixed with white 
> noise 
> > > > > > > (performed 
> > > > > > > > with Audacity), my voice via a microphone, and all 
that 
> > > audio 
> > > > > > > > captured using a free program called "Scanner 
> Recorder". 
> > > You 
> > > > > can 
> > > > > > > > download it here: http://www.davee.com/scanrec/
> > > > > > > > I have not really taken that unit anywhere to test it 
> > > > > properly.  
> > > > > > I 
> > > > > > > > only did the original testing you hear on the video.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > 2) One 12-470 placed in a "chamber", with a noise 
> > generator 
> > > > > (used 
> > > > > > > > a "My Lil' Reminder" 20 second digital 
recorder/player) 
> > > with 
> > > > > > > recorded 
> > > > > > > > white/pink noise I captured while in Florida.  Also 
> > inside 
> > > is 
> > > > > > > > a "Listen Up" amplified microphone and an Olympus 
> digital 
> > > > > > recorder.
> > > > > > > > The only wiring is a Y-connector which connects the 
> > output 
> > > from 
> > > > > > the 
> > > > > > > > amplified mic to the input of the recorder, and also 
to 
> > ear-
> > > > > buds 
> > > > > > > for 
> > > > > > > > listening to what is being recorded. You can also 
plug 
> a 
> > > small 
> > > > > > > > speaker into this if desired.
> > > > > > > > The raw audio from the linear sweep of either the AM 
or 
> > FM 
> > > band 
> > > > > > is 
> > > > > > > > projected from the 12-470 speaker, into the 
> > > closed "chamber", 
> > > > > > along 
> > > > > > > > with the audio from the speaker of the noise 
generator 
> > ("My 
> > > > > Lil' 
> > > > > > > > Reminder") unit.  Those two sources, plus any ambient 
> > noise 
> > > > > > inside 
> > > > > > > > the "chamber" is picked up by the amplified mic and 
fed 
> > > into 
> > > > > the 
> > > > > > > > recorder and ear-buds. The recorder produces the .wav 
> > file.
> > > > > > > > You can use a 12-469 instead of the 12-470. You just 
> need 
> > > to 
> > > > > > > connect 
> > > > > > > > a small speker to the output of the 12-469.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > As with my three 12-469 system, I have so far only 
done 
> > the 
> > > > > > initial 
> > > > > > > > test run on th 12-470 system.  I hope to bring both 
> units 
> > > to a 
> > > > > > > place 
> > > > > > > > where I can do some better experimentation.  I have 2 
> > weeks 
> > > off 
> > > > > > > near 
> > > > > > > > Christmas time, so that is probably when I'll be 
doing 
> > that.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > I hope I have answered your questions, LC.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > - Mike
